docs.lead_paragraph: Because of an editing error, a letter on Monday from Brookline, Mass., about barriers to buying health insurance referred incorrectly to the Affordable Care Act. It is the federal health reform law, not the Massachusetts law.
docs.snippet: Because of an editing error, a letter on Monday from Brookline, Mass., about barriers to buying health insurance referred incorrectly to the Affordable Care Act. It is the federal health reform law, not the Massachusetts law.

docs.lead_paragraph: BRUSSELS -- As prime minister of Latvia, Valdis Dombrovskis has one of the worst jobs in politics, presiding over a fall in living standards in his impoverished country as he slashes salaries and cuts jobs to try to strengthen the nation's depleted finances. For this he gets a pretax annual salary of 32,640, or $45,100. He pays his own health insurance and lives in a three-room, Soviet-built apartment.

headline.main: European Civil Servants Strike Gold in Brussels

docs.snippet: Workers from struggling countries in the east find far higher salaries with the European Union.

docs.lead_paragraph: 8:06 p.m. | Updated Ventas said on Monday that it had agreed to buy Nationwide Health Properties for about $5.7 billion in stock, forming the biggest health care real estate investment trust in the country, with a large presence in senior citizen housing.

headline.main: Ventas to Buy Nationwide Health Properties

docs.abstract: Ventas agrees to buy Nationwide Health Properties for roughly $5.7 billion in stock, forming largest health care real estate investment trust in nation; photo (M)
